intro: Senecio pallens, commonly known as the pale senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually grayish-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Senecio pallens produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators.
